boardgame.name: Lélekpillangó
boardgame.description:
What better adventure than getting to know ourselves and our fellow players? What makes the other happy, what makes him happy?
During the Spirit Butterfly board game, players try to figure out which of their players to choose from. The Soul Butterfly will test how deeply we know others and ourselves. With its unique, special beauty cards and situational situations, it offers many gaming surprises to newcomers to the world of board games.

There are two ways to play the game. Basic game and situational game version.
For the base game, the board must be placed on the A side. Each player chooses one color and receives the corresponding tip puck and puppet. The starting player receives a gray marker card and one of each player's suit. The butterfly card 60 and the gift card 21 must be shuffled and placed face down on the board. This will be the draw deck.
The dealer draws one less card than the number of players and puts it face up. Place at least one face down card on each card. You can also use gray for a card you think is not close to any player. The players then try to guess which card the dealer intended for them by using the tip disc. Depending on how confident you are with one or two point sides. Then the markers turn and the evaluation follows. For correct tips, the player's dummy moves on the scoring bar to score points.
In the situation version, if the dealer is on a situation field, you will have to draw two situation cards and read one of them. You will need to place your marker cards accordingly. The dealer on the smiley field acts according to the basic game. While a player on the doubling field will score all points, but in the case of a dealer, the player can decide whether to play the turn normally or draw from the situation cards.
The winner of the game is the one whose puppy crosses the finish line first or moves to that field.

boardgame.name: Fartzilla
boardgame.description:
Fartzilla is a push your luck dice rolling card game. Players play as kaiju-esqe "bad guys" aiming to destroy as many buildings as possible.

Players guide their individual character or team of characters consisting of: Fartzilla, Bad Phone, Captain Toenail, Chicken Powerup, Lazer Zombie, and Professor Toiler Paper. Teams can be uneven to make game play more challenging for one or more players.

On each player's turn, she chooses the number of building cards to be attacked. Three damage dice and one super power die is rolled. If the player's roll contains a higher number than stated on the buildings chooses, the player has successfully destroyed the buildings and retains the cards for victory points. Alternatively, each character has an icon the super power die. Should the player roll the super power corresponding to a character on her team, the player will destroy chosen buildings, regardless of damage die result.

Superheros are hidden in building deck and can only be defeated with a super power. If not defeated they return back to the deck.

End of game occurs once building deck is exhausted. Winner is determined by total number of building stories destroyed (corresponding number on building card).

—description from the publisher

A fine and sunny day, and the fields are in bloom! The bumblebees are hungry, if a bit short-sighted, and need your help to visit as many flowers as possible. With just a single sheet and a pen, can you guide them through the fields?

Bumbling Bees is a fold-and-write game for a single player, requiring nothing more than a printed sheet of paper, a pair of scissors, and a pen. The current time creates a unique setup condition so no two games are the same. Throughout the game, you will begin to fold your game sheet over on itself, concealing portions of the playing field and creating new opportunities. For fans of roll-and-write games, this offers a similar one-page puzzle experience without the dice.

boardgame.name: Collateral Damage
boardgame.description:
From the kickstarter:

A fast-paced storytelling tabletop roleplaying game for players of all skill levels who will try to survive three acts of movie mayhem!

Publisher's blurb:

IN A WORLD where your everyday life is part of an epic, cinematic experience, things can get a little tense. Mountains crumble...aliens invade...the Statue of Liberty explodes...and you're there to see it all. So why do you spend every day feeling like an extra?

While the stars of the silver screen save lives, find romance, and conquer intergalactic enemies, you're stuck running for your life. Can a group of normal schmucks survive in the world of an action blockbuster?

WELCOME TO COLLATERAL DAMAGE: a fast-paced storytelling tabletop roleplaying game that slams you and your friends in the center of heart-pounding, action-packed movie mayhem. Pop some popcorn, pour a soda, and settle in to your own cinematic experience.

CHOOSE YOUR ROLE:

As a player, you must survive three tense acts of movie mayhem while completing your own objectives.

As a Story Master, you will direct a challenging story for your players, filling it with wacky obstacles and wild twists. Through randomly generated settings, genres, character classes, relationships and much more, the Story Master is provided a toolkit with which to create a masterpiece.

Collateral Damage is usually played as one-shot scenarios that average two to three hours to complete, and is designed to have one Story Master and two to six players.

Collateral Damage has been designed and play tested for over six years, and is ready to make its debut:

STAY ALERT, BE SAFE AND GOOD LUCK.

boardgame.name: Revenants
boardgame.description:
It's the mid 1980ies and a mutated rabies virus wiped out almost every single life on earth. Those, who have been infected with the Zion virus transformed into soulless, bloodthirsty creatures hunting for every living.

Revenants is a tabletop RPG in an post-apocalyptic 80ies scenario with a completely randomized playing field, randomized encounters and randomized loot to grant maximum playing variety over uncountable gaming sessions.
The players slip into the role of those ones, who are resistant against the virus and therefore being able to scavenge contaminated areas for valuable resources and items to support other survivor guilds.

Revenants comes with over 150 desk tiles, with different landscapes like forests, fields, meadows, urban areas, many different buildings, scenes and places - each individually designed, over 60 figurines of Revenant-creatures and eerie mutations, over 300 item cards bearing melee- and ranged weapons, armor, traps, survival-, medical- and household items and many more to make each experience completely unique.

Up to 5 players can choose out of several characters, each one with uniquely abilities and skill trees and keep, train, level up and equip them with everything, they find on their expeditions. As the survivors improve with every game, so do their encounters. Less loot and harder enemies make 'Revenants' a constant challenge for everyone. Whether open range or close combat house-to-house melee fighting: Team play and tactics is important to survive the horde.

boardgame.name: Revenge of the Mortals
boardgame.description:
It is a dark time for the Mortals. Creatures have driven them from their cabins in Camp Murkwood and pursued them all the way to the Forbidden Island.

Evading the dreaded onslaught, a group of fighters led by no one has begun to resist these creature threats with weapons stolen from the mad scientist armory.

These scientists, obsessed with their next great creation, have dispatched creatures to continue the hunt. But this time, the Mortals plan to fight back...

Revenge of the Mortals is a stand alone game in the Campy-verse where players will take on the roles of different Mortals facing 8 rounds of Creature attacks. Armed with unique weapons, players will need to form squads to combat these creatures, and lucky for you, your party of friends are here to help. But in the end, there can be only one hero of the story.

Your goal, in Revenge, is to score the most valuable Relics and Treasures by defeating Creatures. Revenge of the Mortals is played over the course of eight rounds. Every round a new Creature threat is drawn and each player will play a Weapon card from their hand in an attempt to survive the threat and possibly score some sweet Loot. Players can work together as a squad to overcome these threats or turn on each other in order to score more points. Players will negotiate, and then play a card from their hand face-down in front of them. Once everyone has chosen or The Sands of Time has run out (in which case a card must be selected randomly), each player reveals their chosen card simultaneously. Players will either survive the threat or lose Health. Can you survive the night?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Astronomy Fluxx
boardgame.description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Astronomy Fluxx takes you to outer space, featuring stunning NASA photographs of planets and other astronomical objects. Learn about space and humankind's space flight history in this latest installment in the educational Fluxx series.

boardgame.name: Codenames: The Simpsons
boardgame.description:
Codenames: The Simpsons combines the hit social word game Codenames, while featuring characters and locations from thirty years of The Simpsons.

In Codenames, two teams — Team Homer and Team Bart — compete to see who can guess all of their "field agents" (identified by either a word or picture) correctly first — but those field agents are hiding in plain sight in a 5x5 grid that includes the agents of the other team, neutral words, and an assassin that will cause you to lose the game immediately if you guess it. One person on each team is a spymaster and only these two know which agents belong to each team. Spymasters take turns giving one-word clues that can help their teammates identify multiple agents on the board. Their teammates try to guess agents of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team — and everyone wants to avoid the assassin.

boardgame.name: Pronti... A Voi!
boardgame.description:
Pronti… A voi!(Pret... Allez!) is a game for two people lasting about 30 minutes. The players identify themselves with the fencers engaged in an "assault" on the platform. The rules explain the specific rules of the game, but will also explain and deepen the rules and technique of the Fencing and its correct terminology, as used by teachers to teach and communicate with their athletes. Furthermore, a separate booklet is dedicated to a TECHNICAL DEEPENING that focuses on the meaning and explanation of each technique represented by the cards.

The rules manual is divided into 3 different game modes:

Tutorial - it allows you to become familiar with the game mechanisms and to know the cards, moreover some basic fencing principles are introduced without considering the more complex actions. A game for everyone, from the smallest to the oldest, with a few simple basic rules and a classic approach to card games that introduces the world of fencing without difficulty.

Basic Game - introduces the essential aspects of fencing and allows you to start creating the first game strategies depending on the cards available. Suitable for regular players and even for newcomers to fencing.

Advanced Game - simulates the Sword Fencing "at the top"; it is suitable for experienced players and those "regular" athletes who want to practice their favorite sport even on a gaming table.

Pronti… A voi! è un gioco per due persone della durata di 30 minuti circa. I giocatori si immedesimano negli schermidori impegnati in un “assalto” sulla pedana. Nel regolamento vengono spiegate le regole specifiche del gioco, ma verranno anche spiegate e approfondite le regole e la tecnica della Scherma e la sua corretta terminologia, come viene usata dai maestri per insegnare e comunicare con i propri atleti. Inoltre, un libretto a parte è dedicato ad un APPROFONDIMENTO TECNICO che si sofferma sul significato e la spiegazione di ogni tecnica rappresentata dalle carte.

Il manuale delle regole è diviso in 3 modalità di gioco diverse:

Tutorial – permette di acquisire dimestichezza con i meccanismi di gioco e di conoscere le carte, inoltre vengono introdotti alcuni principi di base della scherma senza considerare le azioni più complesse. Un gioco per tutti, dai più piccoli ai più grandi, con poche semplici regole di base ed un approccio classico ai giochi di carte che introduce al mondo schermistico senza difficoltà.

Gioco Base – introduce gli aspetti essenziali della scherma e permette di cominciare a creare le prime strategie di gioco in funzione delle carte a disposizione. Adatto ai giocatori abituali e anche ai neofiti della scherma.

Gioco Avanzato – simula “al top” la Scherma di Spada; è adatto a giocatori esperti e a quegli atleti “abituali” che vogliono praticare il loro sport preferito anche su un tavolo da gioco.

boardgame.name: Shadow Master
boardgame.description:
To master the Guilds, you must first master the shadows. You ply your trade lurking in the depths of the city, while committing unspeakable skulduggery and, all the while, developing your dark arts and spell craft. Direct confrontation is not your preference; however, there will be times you must fight to advance through the challenges, quests and battles that lay ahead. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing Guilds, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page. You roll. You write. Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask. This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) further into the Fantasy Realm.

1 Character Page (actually, this is entire game . . . except for the dice . . . oh, and a pen or pencil)

Harter Tobak is a German card game by Simon & Jan where you have to fill in the blanks and build card combinations.
The standard version of it launched in 2014, the Mobbing Edition. In the end of 2018 the Mobbing Edition has been released.

The 2014 version was very comparable to cards against humanity individualized by a whole bunch of special cards that changed the game mechanisms mid-game.

The so called Mobbing Edition from 2018 brought in a very unique focus by specializing on bullying the people playing this game. In every round there is one bully and one bullying victim. The card combinations that need to be created have the goal to hit the chosen bullying victim.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game
boardgame.description:
Korowai people is a real ancient tribe that lives today in West Papua of Indonesia. Isolated from modern world, they live their life using primitive tools and method. Hunting wild boars, fishing and eat sago as their main food source. They build their house at the top of the trees to avoid wild beast in the night. Korowai also believe in spirits and God, so they have festival, myths, and folktales that honor around their Gods.

Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game is a game about survival and adventure of Korowai tribesman. Player will become a tribesman that will hunt, farm, and logging for the live of their tribe. While they must avoid any danger, wild beast, hazards, or any catastrophic event they encounter.

Korowai is a push your luck game in its essence. While adventuring, players will open a card in adventure deck. Then, simultaneously player must decide to play their top card deck, their hand, or pass. There is some good cards and bad cards in their deck depending on the adventure card they encounter in that round. After 9 to 12 adventure cards, player will be back to their village. In the village player must eat their hunts, build their house, gain a new skill, and participate in the festival.

Player who have the most Experience Points, will become the next chieftain of the village and wins the game.

boardgame.name: Hadara: Marketplaces & Monuments
哈达拉：市集与纪念碑
하다라: 시장과 기념물
boardgame.description:
The Hadara: Marketplaces & Monuments mini-expansion brings two new elements to the game: monuments and marketplaces. Marketplaces allow players to profit from extra food. Monuments will award players many points if they expand military and culture equally.

Monuments require 24 points in each of culture and military. If you reuse the monument, you get 12 coins and 16 victory points. If you pay 4 coins to build it, you'll get even more points and additional movement on a track or end game points.

The market tiles have 2 sides - a small side (6 yellow, 2 extra green) and a large side (18 yellow, 6 extra green). After you do your normal income, if you've met these requirements, add (or flip) the market tile to your marketplace. If a market tile is present, gain bonus coins (1 for the small, 2 for large) which may be added to your coin pool or placed below the market. Coins in the market will bump the corresponding track or contribute to end game points. Your marketplace is also worth 5 (small) or 15 (large) points at the end of the game.

The pirates speak of a rich treasure hidden in an ancient and ruined temple guarded by some fell beast. They even speak of giving you a share of the booty and slaves they’ve already taken aboard if you help them rid the world of the monster guarding the treasure. There’s silver to be won here.

Their ship, the Sultan’s Pleasure, is swift and sturdy, a proper predator hunting the fat merchantmen of Europe, but spend a few days with the crew and you’ll soon notice things are not quite right. Talk of a strange disease among the crew, the Captain’s obsession with a map he refuses to show anyone, and the wild tales of demons and madness from the captives begin to draw a picture of larger stakes than mere treasure and threats greater than a lone monster lurking in the wilderness. Shifting personalities lead to shifting alliances. Who can you trust? And what secrets are the pirates keeping from you?

An adventure for Lamentations of the Flame Princess and other traditional tabletop role-playing games.

boardgame.name: Bagolytanoda
boardgame.description:
Bagolytanoda is an educational board game for children between 8 and 10. It is supporting the studies of elementary school second, third and fourth classes, for Hungarian language and nature subjects. The game not only asks for existing knowledge but helps with teaching the basic material personalized for each single class. The game uses tile placement mechanism, and so the environment is variable while owls are discovering the surroundings. Questions are card-based, right answers worth gems, which may be spent on marketplaces, buying antique codexes.

—user summary

A Bagolytanoda egy oktató kvízjáték, ami az alsó tagozatos anyanyelvi és környezetismereti tananyagra épülve a legalapvetőbb tudnivalókat nem csupán kikérdezi, játékosan meg is tanítja.

A kérdéseket általános iskolai tanítók segítségével állítottuk össze, külön a második, a harmadik, és a negyedik osztályos tananyagot támogatva, így a játékosok az évfolyamuknak megfelelően választhatnak a paklik közül. Helytállását szakmai szempontból a Tanítók Egyesületének ajánlása igazolja. A játék izgalmas felfedezőút is egyben, a gyerekek a játéktér önálló építésének köszönhetően aktívan gyakorolják a számolást, az előrelátó tervezést és az erőforrásaikkal való gazdálkodást.

A játék során a gyerekek bagolyfiókák bőrébe bújnak, akik tanulmányi kirándulásra indulnak. A még ismeretlen terepet körről körre maguk építik, és drágaköveket gyűjtenek, mindeközben feleletválasztós kérdésekre válaszolnak. Ha áldoznak rá plusz lépést, a könyvtárban akár meg is nézhetik, mi a soron következő kérdés, így magabiztosan indulhatnak tovább gyűjtögetni. Ha a játékosok elegendő kincset gyűjtöttek, felkereshetik a piacon kereskedő bölcs baglyokat, akiktől kódexeket vásárolhatnak. Az nyer, aki a legtöbb kódexet gyűjti össze a játék során.

boardgame.name: Socianimals
boardgame.description:
Socianimals is a card game about animals and families. The main goal of the game is to collect as many animals of the same family as you can. The more animals in the same family you collect the more points you score.
Every player starts with 5 cards in its hand. Every turn a player takes a card from a covered common deck (thus reaching 6 cards in hand) and then must play a card.

Once a card (an animal) is on the table another player can take it only if he has an animal of the same family. Once a player take a couple of animals from the same family those 2 cards must be put covered near the player who took them and they are part of his/her deck points.

Special cards can be played to steal/block/protect animals family(a couple or more couple of the same family).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aegis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Aegis is a game inspired by Japanese console RPGs that both tactical gamers and fans of narrating exciting stories will love. As agents of an elite corp in charge of exploring the ruins of a lost civilization, players must embark on dangerous missions in uncharted territories filled with unexpected dangers. They will clear their way with energy guns, sharp katanas and mystic spells, but above all with the mysterious Artifacts, symbiotes created by the technology of the Ancients which turn their owners into the preferred target of the dreadful members of the Forsaken Legion.

Each member has his or her role in the team, be it investigation or combat, which will have a strong influence on how exploration and armed conflicts evolve. By means of an innovative combat system based on a simple battle grid, Aegis incorporates a strong tactical component into its gameplay, while still focusing on how each player narrates each attack his or her character makes, rather than on the mechanical part of combat.

Aegis will give you plenty of memorable game evenings, either by playing a single, frenzied mission, or by following your heroes' deeds through a long and exciting adventure saga.

boardgame.name: Veneto By Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Veneto region is really a peculiar case in the world of the Damned. The same unassailable rule of the Giovanni, which should guarantee stability to the region, is in fact paradoxically the cause of one of the most bizarre conflicts inflaming the sons of Cain in modern nights, “la Danza dei Burattini” (the Dance of Puppets). The term, forged in derisive spirit by a Ventrue Elder visiting Venice, has immediately become popular in the Venetian halls. It indicates the constant state of war involving everything and everyone beyond Venice. Three different courts, each with its own Prince, have proclaimed themselves the Court of Venice. What makes the situation comical, at least to outside observers and in Giovanni's eyes, is that none of these self-styled Princes have passed the century of non-life. They look like children fighting over toys while their parents are busy at work.

For the Necromancers, the Venetian Neonates are living contradictions: they fight to the death to restore a glory that was already surpassed long before their Embrace, to recover territories in the name of clans that have no real desire to get them back, and to win a throne that does not even exist. Therefore, the Dance of Puppets is generally ignored by the lords of Venice, except when the occasional Neonate does something especially stupid. When that occurs the parents enter the children room, take the toys away, and then peace returns - at least temporarily. However, as soon as the adults turn their backs, the process starts all over again, like an eternal, never ending play.

Actually, many Elders would probably stop laughing if they took the trouble to get off their golden thrones and pay more attention to what is really happening.

When the puppets dance, in fact, you can be sure that puppeteers are around. And if only someone would take the trouble to follow the strings of the puppets, they would discover which monstrous spider hides in the center of the web...


Il Veneto è davvero un caso peculiare nel mondo dei Dannati. Lo stesso dominio inattaccabile dei Giovanni, che dovrebbe garantire stabilità alla regione, è infatti paradossalmente la causa di uno dei più bizzarri conflitti che infiammano i figli di Caino nelle notti moderne, la Danza dei Burattini. Il termine, forgiato in tono derisorio da un Anziano Ventrue in visita a Venezia, è divenuto subito popolare nei salotti veneziani: esso indica lo stato di guerra costante che infiamma tutto ciò che è oltre Venezia. Di fatto, tre corti diverse, ciascuna con il proprio Principe, si sono autoproclamate Corte di Venezia. La cosa che rende la situazione comica, agli occhi di Giovanni e osservatori esterni, è che nessuno di questi sedicenti Principi ha superato il secolo di non vita: di fatto, sembrano bimbi che litigano contendendosi i giocattoli mentre i genitori sono impegnati a lavoro.

Per i Necromanti, i Neonati veneti sono delle contraddizioni viventi: lottano all'ultimo sangue per restaurare una gloria che era già sorpassata molto prima del loro Abbraccio, per riconquistare territori in nome di clan che in realtà non hanno alcun desiderio di riaverli e per ottenere un trono che nemmeno esiste davvero. La Danza dei Burattini viene quindi generalmente ignorata dai signori di Venezia, se non quando l'occasionale Infante fa qualcosa di davvero stupido: allora i genitori entrano nella cameretta, sequestrano i giocattoli e ritorna la pace – almeno per un po'. Basta infatti che gli adulti voltino di nuovo le spalle, e tutto ricomincia da capo, in un'eterna recita che non pare destinata a finire mai.

In realtà, probabilmente molti Anziani smetterebbero di ridere, se si prendessero la briga di scendere dai loro piedistalli dorati e osservare con maggiore attenzione cosa sta accadendo.

Quando i burattini ballano, infatti, si può star certi che dei burattinai debbano essere nei paraggi. E se solo qualcuno si preoccupasse di seguire i fili delle marionette, scoprirebbe quale mostruoso ragno si nasconda al centro della tela...

boardgame.name: Ostroleka 16 lutego 1807
boardgame.description:
Ostrołęka 16 lutego 1807 covers the battle of Ostrołęka, fought on Feb. 16, 1807 between the French 5th Corps commanded by Gen. Jean-Anne-Marie Savary and the Russian Corps commanded by Gen. Ivan N. Essen. The main goal of the French Corps was to secure the supply line of Napoleon’s main army fighting with Gen. Bennigsen. Just after the bloody battle of Preussisch Eylau (Feb. 7-8, 1807) both sides started to look for possibilities of taking advantage over the enemy and draw away some opposite forces from the main theater before the next expected battle. After set of back and forth operations in the north Mazovia, Russians decided to launch an offensive against units of the Frech 5th Corps situated near Ostrołęka. Russian commander, Gen. Essen, strengthened by the 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski, prepared a plan of attack. He decided to divide his forces into two wings. One of them (6th Division and a part of 9th Division), commanded by Gen. Wolkonski, had to attack the town Ostrołęka from the north, approaching along the west bank of Narew river. The other wing (10th Division and a part of 9th Division), commanded by Gen. Essen, approaching along the east bank of Narew river, had to attack the town Ostrołęka from the east. Russians had significant numerical advantage but their problem was that both operational groups were completely separated by the impassable river with marshy banks and in effect could not suport each other.

Before the battle started, Russians had made feign attacks near Myszyniec along the line of communication of the main French army, north-west of Ostrołęka, fooling the French command. Gen. Savary decided to send there whole 1st Infantry Division of Gen. Suchet. Before the battle started, two events had taken place that had great impact on the course of it. The first one caused that Russians completely lost surprise effect. French caught the Russian messanger with letter from Essen to Bennigsen, from which they got to know the plan of the offensive. However we do not know how many details of it. The second event was also disadvantageous for the Russian Corps command. Gen. Bennigsen, who was the commander-in-chief of all Russian forces operating against Napoleon, recalled 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski to the main Russian army, to the north. Gen. Wolkonski, supported by Gen. Essen, tried to convince Gen. Sedmioradski to postpone execution of this order and take part in the planned ofensive against French 5th Corps, but Sedmioradski decided to obey strictly order from the upper commander and had marched to the north just befeore the offensive started. The effect was that Wolkonski’s group which had to advance along the west bank of Narew river was reduced to 1/3 of its units.

The battle of Ostrołęka fought in 1807 is a classical example of the maneuver from a central position. Knowing more or less enemy’s plans, early morning of Feb. 16, 1807, near 4 AM Gen. Savary also decided to divide his forces into two groups. He found the Russian wing approaching along the west bank of the Narew river as more dangerous because it could had cut him off from his line of communication. That is why he decided to march with the majority of his forces to the north, defeat it as the first and then revert back to the Ostrołęka to fight with the rest of the Russians. In Ostrołęka Savary left only 8 battalions with some artillery and cavalry. They had to defend and keep the town until he had defeated the enemy approaching from the north. Battle fought by Savary with Wolkonski’s group near Stanisławów was quick. Russian General, seeing enemy strongly outnumbering his group, after short combat started retreat. It was 10 AM when being near Stanisławów Savary heard the sound of cannonade coming from Ostrołęka. At that moment he realised the Russian group he defeated was the smaller one and the main Russian forces were at Ostrołęka attacking small French contingent he had left there in the morning to defend the town and area around it. Leaving some units to pursuit Wolkonski’s group Savary ordered force march to Ostrołęka. It was noon when the first units of his group appeared near the town where they met coming back from the north west 1st Infantry Division of Gen. Suchet. How defenders of the town were able to keep control of it to that time is another story. Some historical sources mention that although outnumbered, they even attacked Russians in the first part of the battle, confusing them and disturbing the decisive attack. Also some parts of Essen’s group were delayed. Finally, near noon, when the defenders were about to lose, suprisingly Russian attacks on the town stopped. Russian command decided to withdraw to the positions to the east of Ostrołęka, stay there until the end ot the day and make retreat during night. When Savary’s group and the 1st Infantry Division crossed the Narew river and formed the battle line, the last part of the battle commenced. There were no more than 2 hours to the dusk but it was enough for the French to break Essen’s group, however in effect of darkness, early coming during winter, the victory was not so overwhelming as it had been if the French had had more time. It is estimated that Russian lost 2500-3000 casualties, while French 1500-2000 ones.

The game is an expansion for Ostrołęka 26 maja 1831. It means that Ostrołęka 16 lutego 1807 uses system rules (also charts & tables), markers and the board which are in Ostrołęka 26 maja 1831. There are special rules for this historical period and battle (2 pages only). There are three scenarios in the game:
- The Defense of Ostrołęka,
- Operational,
- The Battle on the East Bank of the Narew River.
The first scenario covers the initial part of the battle. Its feature is a chit-pull system, used to simulate activity of the French units at the beginning of the combat and their better command system. The second scenario, the largest one, allows to play the whole battle. Its aim is also to show the operational background around the battlefield. It tries to join two levels of warfare: tactical and operational. In fact it is a kind of scenario generator: each player can choose among few options how to divide his forces among two groups. This decision has a great impact on the course of the game. Another important decision up to the Russian player is possible bringing to the battle Russian 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski, what gives him more forces but changes victory conditions to more demanding for the Russians. There is a plenty of additional options for this scenario. The third scenario depicts the last part of the battle, great frontal struggle on the east bank of the Narew river with most of the units participating in it. The playing time varies depending on the scenario, style of play and many other factors. The third scenario is the shortest while the second scenario as a whole is definitely the longest one. However in case of lack time, basing on the second scenario you can create little battles which can be played in 2-3 hours.

Components (all packed in ziplock):
- 324 die-cut counters (9 small counter sheets)
- One rulebook and scenariobook (both in one book)
- Two sheets with unit rosters (for French and Russians)
- One sheet with turn tracks
- Four bags for counters

A SOURCEBOOK FOR VAMPIRE: THE DARK AGES 20TH ANNIVERSARY EDITION

“And when all was ready for sailing, Egil went up into the island. He took in his hand a hazel-pole, and went to a rocky eminence that looked inward to the mainland. Then he took a horse’s head and fixed it on the pole...The horse’s head he turned inwards to the mainland; but on the pole he cut runes, expressing the whole form of curse.”

The Curse Pole is a One-Page Chronicle jumpstart. Inside you’ll find guidance on a plotline you can use to start your Vampire: The Dark Ages 20th Chronicle. This Jumpstart can be used in nearly any location in the Dark Medieval world.

boardgame.name: Cleocatra
boardgame.description:
SUMMARY

Egyptians love cats, especially Cleopatra. When she ruled Egypt, she commissioned cat rescuers to protect cats, and royal cat inspectors to report and reward rescuers. In her time, cats were napping happily and safely in the sun throughout Egypt.

GOAL

In this game, the players are Egyptian cat rescuers, and their goal is to save cats in pyramids. A player receives 1 point for every unique cat rescued, plus 1 point per helper on the scoring tiles. When a player has scored 23 or more points, the game continues until the end of the current round. The player with the most points wins the game.

COMPONENTS

Rescuer meeple x 12 (Three for each player)
Score token x 4 (One for each player)
Cat pyramid tile x 13 (Three of each color, plus Cleocatra)
Royal Inspector token x 3 (brown)
Score track x 1
Rules

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Soviet Fallout: The Nagorno-Karabakh War – 1992-1994
boardgame.description:
The Nagorno-Karabakh War: Soviet Fallout: 1992-1994 is a simulation of the war between Azerbaijan and the breakaway province (Oblast) of Nagorno-Karabakh, inhabited by a majority of Armenians. After the first ethnic clashes between Armenians and Azeri, during the death throes of the Soviet Union, Nagorno-Karabakh declared independence from Azerbaijan. The Azeri launched an ethnic cleansing campaign. Faced with annihilation, the Armenians resisted and fought back, conquering most of Nagorno-Karabakh and parts of eastern Azerbaijan, a situation which has lasted until today (2019).

The Nagorno-Karabakh War is a two player game: the Armenian (AR) player and the Azeri (AZ) player. The AR player must fight a numerically superior foe but he has the advantage of interior lines and a unified command, whereas the AZ player has a greater supply of former Red Army weapons and ammunition but has to fight not only the Armenians but also political infighting and low morale. In this game, the enemy population it is not the victim of collateral damage: the enemy population is the target, so conquering towns and villages and practicing ethnical cleansing is a key aspect of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Grande Évasion
boardgame.description:
In this prison, it isn't very complicated: the prisoners try to escape, and the guards try to stop them. Whether you find yourself playing the role of a prisoner or a guard, do the best you can.

The game is played in several round, continuing until one player (or more) achieves a score of 4 points.

Each round will be dealt a secret roles, and a hand of card. You play those card to help, or not in an escape routes. Cards have to be alternately placed face up / face down with the first card played on the route determining the order.

At the end of a round, each player will secretly select one route.
Then we reveal each card of each route, if the total number exceed the route demand and no gard is here, then the prisoners on this route escape and score one point each.
If any gard or if the total is lower, no escape, no point.
If no prisoner at all escapes, then each gard score 1 point.
New round...

boardgame.name: Landskapsspelet
boardgame.description:
This is one of several themed Go Fish/Quartet variants published by K. Hjelm Förlag around the 2000s. The subject is the 25 Swedish provinces, each set of four cards consisting of: one showing the province on a map of Sweden, also listing significant towns, lakes and rivers; one showing the coat of arms; one showing the province animal; and one showing the province plant. A special bonus card shows the coat of arms of Stockholm.

Each player gets an initial hand of seven cards. Gameplay proceeds as normal for Go Fish, with players demanding cards from each other and drawing from the talon, setting any completed sets aside. Bonus points are given for scoring many sets from any of the three major regional divisions, and for drawing the Stockholm card.

There is no maximum number of players stated, but the deck size will support a deal to 14 players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Domani Brucerà
El Mañana Debe Arder
Tomorrow Must Burn
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

The Age of Ashes Adventure Path continues! In defeating the treacherous Cult of Cinders, the heroes discover a nefarious group pulling the cult's strings—a mysterious merchant's guild called the Scarlet Triad. Following clues and utilizing another portal found below their castle on Hellknight Hill, the heroes come to the recently founded nation of Ravounel, where they must stand against the Scarlet Triad as the group attempts to establish an underground slave trade. But as the heroes clash more and more with the Scarlet Triad, it becomes increasingly apparent the slavers have even more sinister plans for the Inner Sea region–plans that must be stopped!

Age of Ashes is the first Adventure Path using the brand new rules for the Pathfinder RPG. This third adventure is for 9th-level characters, and also includes a gazetteer to the newly formed nation of Ravounel, an exploration of the dragons of the world, a wealth of new options for player characters to discover (from magic items, spells, and feats, to a new class archetype), and more than half a dozen new monsters!

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

boardgame.name: Wake Up Sheeple
boardgame.description:
Wake Up Sheeple is a conspiracy theorist's card game about finding the truth. The game has players take the role of the General Public and the Mainstream Media. Each Mainstream Media player must use their own Subject and Motive cards to tell the General Public what actually happened during an Event drawn from the event deck.

This game is not simply a fill in the blank game. We encourage players to craft their own insane truth to explain what happened and answer the question which the General Public has posed.

The General Public player will choose the winners for the rounds by picking the story they choose to believe. They may choose the winner by whatever criteria they like.

The winning player will keep the Event card for scorekeeping. A Mainstream News Player is considered to have won the game by having a set amount of News Stories accepted into the mainstream - that amount may be 3, 5, 10, or as many as players like.

boardgame.name: BITE
boardgame.description:
As the harvest approaches, the villagers gather and ponder the coming winter. Among them, darkness lurks, corrupting the town and its inhabitants. Unlikely allies will rise to either save this village or condemn it.

Can you make it through the lengthening nights and save the town? Or is something creeping up on you, disguised as a neighbor, waiting for its chance to BITE?

BITE is a social deduction game with secret roles for social gatherings. Players receive roles and pair up for a few minutes of conversation at a time, at the end of which each reveals an action card to the other player. They resolve these cards and move on to the next discussion, their motives changing throughout the game based upon which side they find themselves: Good or Evil. By the final night, either darkness will have been rooted out of the town, or it will have triumphed.

Each role has action cards associated with it that reveal information about their conversation partner, protect them from harm, convert them to their side, or kill them off in various ways. The roles are themed to a gothic fantasy setting including Witches, Hunters, Villagers, Occultists, Vampires and the like.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pontiac's War: 1763-1766
boardgame.description:
“I mean to destroy the English and leave not one upon our lands.” Pontiac
“It is not in the Indian’s power to affect anything of consequence.” Major Gladwin.”

Pontiac’s War 1763-1766 followed on the heels of the French and Indian War which ended in 1763. Thanks to Indian resentment over the French surrender of their lands and the harsh policies of General Jeffery Amherst, governor-general of British North America, 20+ Indian nations rose up under the charismatic leadership of the Ottawa sachem, Pontiac and the Lenape Holy Man, Neolin. When the powder-smoke cleared, 450 British soldiers and countless Indians had lost their lives. Two thousand settlers were either killed or captured and 4000 more had been displaced. Moreover, Britain’s foreign conflicts had put the Crown 140 million £ in debt. These expenses led directly to a series of unpopular taxes in North America which in turn led directly to another uprising, our colonial revolution.

Pontiac’s War attempts to recreate the reaction of Indian leaders to British mishandling of frontier politics and the impending colonial crisis it presaged. Building on the point-to-point system and loose Indian alliances used in King Philip’s War and Blood on the Ohio, this design expands frontier conflict using Battle cards to introduce combat chaos, British expenditure on troops, Uncertain Indian Armssupply, siege rules, the capture of prisoners, French interference and trader influence.

The game offers five short introductory scenarios (15-30 minutes), three one-year campaign scenarios (2 hours), and one three-year grand campaign (5-6 hours). Although not a solitaire design, it is solitaire friendly. Players will appreciate the high-production quality of the components which includes a MOUNTED game map and large, 338 3/4" size punch-out counters.

Product Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: Seasonal turns (approx. 3 months per turn)
Map Scale: Point-to-Point map (approx. 60-75 miles between points)
Unit Scale: 30-50 men, 4-6 artillery guns, individual officers and sea vessels
Players: 1 or 2 (best with 2)
Playing Time: from 15 minutes (intro scenarios) to 6 hours (grand campaign)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SEN: Save The Queen
boardgame.description:
In medieval times, twin princess rise in power to become queen. They split the land into west and east. Both queens hate each other and feel envious that the opposing land is greater than their land. Then one fateful day, these two queens rally their armies to wage war between themselves.

In SEN: Save The Queen, each player becomes the queen of their respective kingdom and duels to take the lands of the other. Using only eighteen tiles to play, each player must outwit the other to trap the opposing queen. Each player has three types of units: swordsmen, spearmen, and horsemen. The battlefield is a 3x3 grid of tiles, with each player's queen occupying an opposing corner and a priest as a neutral unit in the middle of the battlefield. Then each player in turn, places their units in the available spaces.

Gameplay is simple: There are eight action cards, and each player holds three cards at the beginning of the game. In turn order, each player can play a card from their side or take back two cards to their side of field. Each card affects certain units they control to move or attack opposing units. The player who can successfully occupy two adjacent grids owned by the enemy queen with their healthy units wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cities & Towns: Hârnic Lore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compared to other regions of western Lythia, the island of Hârn is not very urbanized. The proportion of Hârnians who dwell in towns varies by region, but nowhere exceeds 15 percent. Towns are, in fact, outside the mainstream of Hârnic culture and represent a somewhat alien sub-culture with its own values and societal patterns.

Unlike the countryside, towns are dominated by the activities of the powerful guilds and it is the activities of these guilds that justify a town’s very existence. Towns are essentially defensible markets. The relationship between town and country is fairly clear. The countryside trades its surplus agricultural produce for the “civilized” artifacts of the city. The relationship is symbiotic; each has its own monopoly, but the countryside could exist without towns while the converse is untrue.

This article gives an overview of how urban life works and includes brief descriptions of each of the seven cities (walled towns) of Hârn. Topics covered include:

How cities are run: Government, charters, and officials
How cities are structured: Geography, land use, markets, neighborhoods
Who lives in cities: Social classes, guilded and unguilded workers
How is it paid for: Taxes, tolls, and fees

boardgame.name: Les Chroniques de la Lune de Sang Saison 1, Épisode 6: Lyon By Night
Lyon By Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lyon By Night is the last chapter of the Chronicles of the Blood Moon, Season 1. Play Archons of the Camarilla or Sabbat Templars.

But this is not an adventure, like the previous episodes, It’s an entire city !

It can be played as a stand-alone adventure and even if the PCs are not Archons or Templars

The vampires of Lyon, France, are gone.

The Prince of Paris has dispatched two exploration missions that have returned empty-handed.

There is no trace of vampires, even the ghouls are missing. Are they whiped out by a Methuselah or an Antediluvian, kill by God, by Cain, because of a Sabbat blow?

No one knows what happened to them. Nobody claimed this strange disappearance. The only trace found is ashes in a shelter.

After a few nights of fear, Lyon has appeared for many Kindred as a new territory to conquer : a great city without any Cainite presence. The opportunity to make a place in the sun or rather under the moon.

Many vampires will rush to the city, to cease a share of wealth, power or create an utopia. The PC are part of these Cainites.

This book contains:

A description of the city of Lyon, France
Portrait of thirty vampires
A dozen story arcs and over seventy story hooks



Lyon By Night est le dernier scénario de la saison 1 des Chroniques de la Lune de Sang qui proposent de jouer des Archontes de la Camarilla ou des Templiers du Sabbat. La saison 1 compte 6 épisodes.

Mais ce n’est pas un scénario comme les précédents épisodes, c’est une ville entière à découvrir !

Les vampires de la ville de Lyon ont disparu. Le Prince de Paris a dépêché deux missions d’exploration qui sont revenues bredouilles. Il n’y a plus aucune trace des vampires de Lyon, et même les goules sont portées manquantes. Massacrés par un mathusalem ou un antédiluvien, éliminés par Dieu, par Caïn, du fait d’un coup du Sabbat ? Nul ne sait ce qui leur est arrivé. Personne n’a revendiqué cette étrange disparition. La seule trace retrouvée sont des cendres dans un refuge, l’un des seuls découverts par les équipes d’exploration.
Passé quelques jours d’hésitation et de peur de l’inconnu, Lyon est apparue pour beaucoup de Vampires comme un nouveau monde à conquérir. Une grande ville vierge de toute présence caïnite. L’occasion de se faire une place au soleil ou plutôt sous la Lune.
De nombreux vampires vont donc se ruer sur la ville, pour essayer de s’approprier une part de richesse, de pouvoir ou d’y créer une utopie. Les PJ font partie de ces caïnites.

Cet ouvrage contient :

Une description détaillée de la ville de Lyon
Plus de trente vampires venus à Lyon
Une dizaine d’Arcs narratifs accompagnés de plus de soixante-dix évènements

boardgame.name: 100 Red Talon Kinfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

100 Red Talon Kinfolk provides a quick way to generate appropriate NPCs to support the Red Talon tribe. Here are 100 wolves that could be kin of the Talons.

All garou share the nature of the wolf, but nowhere is it more realized than within the Red Talons. A tribe that refused to embrace any aspect of humanity, seeing them as a plague upon the world and a blight to their people, Red Talons revel in their primal nature. Some see them as relics of the early ages, and others as dangerous predators, and there’s some truth to both. Not that the Red Talons have much use for the opinions of others… even if those others are also garou.

Like all tribes, Red Talons have kinfolk. Unlike the other tribes, though, they are almost without exception lupine. While man has clawed to the top of the food chain, the Red Talons believe that he is still a prey animal in his heart of hearts. They are the predators, and packs of Red Talon kinfolk are as fearsome and determined to stand against the Wyrm today as they have been in times gone past. Even if their numbers, like those of all wolves, have given ground over the years.

1 Elf standee to be assembled and 8 tokens (4 Gift and 4 Empty).

Set up:
Place the Elf standee in the third Wagon from the back of the train. Take as many tokens as there are Bandits, half Gift and half Empty. If there is an odd number of Bandits, take an Empty token of more than Gift Tokens. (Example: with 5 Bandits, take 2 Gift and 3 Empty).
Shuffle the selected tokens face down and give one to each Bandit. These tokens must remain hidden from the opponents throughout the game. If you play with the Marshal & Prisoners expansion, do not give the marshal a token.

Rules:
The Elf moves only following the bandits in motion.
When a Bandit starts his movement triggered by an action Change Floor or Move from the position where the Elf is, move the Elf with the Bandit.
The Elf can park on Marshal’s position.
The Elf is not moved if the Bandit’s move is due to a Punch, an encounter with the Marshal, a Django shot or an end of round event.
The Elf can not be targeted by a shot or a punch.
If you play with the Horses & Stagecoach expansion, the Elf follows the Bandits in the Ride Action. He can enter and leave the stagecoach. He can park on the Shotgun’s position.
If you play with the Marshal & Prisoners expansion, the Elf does not follow the Bandits in prison. He does not follow the Marshal either. If the Marshal does not win the game, the end-of-game rule below applies as with the basic game.

End of game:
The Gunslinger prize is awarded then all Bandits reveal their Gift or Empty token.

If the Elf is in the Locomotive or the Car adjacent to the Locomotive (inside or on the roof) at the end of the game, the winner is the richest Bandit among players with a Gift token. Players with an empty token are automatically eliminated.
If the Elf is at least two cars away from the Locomotive, the winner is the richest Bandit among those with an Empty token. Players with a Gift token are automatically eliminated.

boardgame.name: Hunters Hunted: Awakening
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Investigating a brutal crime, Renato begins to realize that the world hide secrets that could lead him to madness. Haunted by strange dreams, Sara divides herself between two lives, trapped by her past mistakes in a quest for redemption. A boy wakes up alone in a dark alley, with no memory and no hope. Jonas hides a dark secret that may be the key to the salvation of mankind.

HUNTERS HUNTED: AWAKENING is a Solo-Chronicle designed to be played without a Storyteller, where you will be the main character. In the first chapter of this chronicle, you're going to lead Renato, a São Paulo police detective, in charge of unraveling a mysterious murder. On the second chapter, you will have the chance to lead Sara, a stripper disturbed by strange dreams engaging in a thriling pursuit.

ON THIS ISSUE YOU WILL FIND:

The First and Second chapter of an unpublished and exclusive Solo-Chronicle: Hunters Hunted: Awakening;
158 page PDF e-book containing 125 narrative blocks and totalizing 221 hyperlinks;
Choose between two Game Modes, Standard (V4 rules system simplified) and Casual (no dice or paper needed).
Checkpoints and Save System: Save the progress of your campaign and keep your choices (and consequences) saved for the next chapters;
Vintage layout and Art style celebrating the classic gamebooks of the 80's
